summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection inspects travel and trade at our nation's borders. The agency must secure the nation's borders while ensuring the respectful, impartial treatment of travelers. CBP has issued policies and designed trainings to help prevent discrimination during traveler inspections. We reviewed CBP's efforts and found that it has procedures in place to help prevent discrimination and to address traveler complaints. For example...
title: Traveler Inspections: DHS Mechanisms to Help Prevent Discrimination and Address Complaints
